CLUE: Uppermost attachment of a vessel's rigging
OUTPUT: ['Forestay: Similar to headstay but typically refers to fore and aft stays supporting the mast from both ends; however, when referring specifically to "uppermost," it is usually the forestay.', "Jibboom: A spar that extends forward of the bowsprit (if present) and supports the jib sail's tack point but can be considered part of the uppermost rigging if we include attachments for sails beyond just stays.", 'Masthead Stay: The wire or rope running from the top of the mast to a fitting on the deck, holding it up and keeping its position steady against wind pressures.']
